discussion_comments.comment_body:
```suggestion
    "test": "jest",
```

Please revert this. You can do the same thing on the CLI with `npm test -- --projects packages/react-router --watch`

commented_code:
"test": "jest",
     "test:inspect": "node --inspect-brk ./node_modules/.bin/jest",
     "typecheck": "pnpm run --recursive --parallel typecheck",
-    "pretest:integration": "pnpm build",
-    "test:integration": "pnpm playwright:integration",
-    "posttest:integration": "pnpm clean:integration",
+    "test:integration:run": "pnpm playwright:integration",
+    "test:integration": "pnpm build && pnpm test:integration:run",
+    "posttest:integration:run": "pnpm clean:integration",

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -16,9 +16,9 @@
     "test": "jest",
     "test:inspect": "node --inspect-brk ./node_modules/.bin/jest",
     "typecheck": "pnpm run --recursive --parallel typecheck",
-    "pretest:integration": "pnpm build",
-    "test:integration": "pnpm playwright:integration",
-    "posttest:integration": "pnpm clean:integration",
+    "test:integration:run": "pnpm playwright:integration",
+    "test:integration": "pnpm build && pnpm test:integration:run",
+    "posttest:integration:run": "pnpm clean:integration",
discussion_comments.comment_body: This makes it easier to re-run the test without a build vis `pnpm test:integration:run` to iterate on test contents without changing source code.
